avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger above 1600m is moderate, below that altitude danger ris low. Main problem:  wet snow. Wet glide-snow avalanches are possible at any time on grass-covered slopes, in sparsely wooded zones and over smooth rock places. In addition, naturally triggered wet loose-snow avalanches are possible on extremely steep slopes which have not yet discharged. At high altitudes there is still sufficient snow for avalanches to grow to medium size.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In Allgau, likelihood of wet-snow avalanches triggering in late afternoon will increase, due to rainfall

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowpack on shady slopes is thoroughly wet up to high altitudes. A thin melt-freeze crust can form during the nighttime hours, but softens swiftly during the morning. On south-facing slopes up to high altitudes, hardly any snow on the ground. On shady slopes, there is snow on the ground above 1400m.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is low. Wet snow can be problematic. On smooth, very steep slopes which have not yet discharged, small wet glide-snow avalanches are possible in all aspects. Where the snow on the ground is sufficient, small naturally triggered wet loose-snow avalanches are possible. In Allgau, likelihood of wet-snow avalanches triggering in late afternoon will increase, due to rainfall
avalancheActivity.highlights: What snow remains lies mostly on high-altitude north-facing slopes

snowpackStructure.comment: What snow remains is thoroughly wet. During the night a thin melt-freeze crust can form only in the eastern regions, and it softens rapidly in the morning. On south-facing slopes up to high altitudes, hardly any snow on the ground. On shady slopes, there is snow on the ground above 1400m.

tendency.highlights: Avalanche danger levels will remain low.

customData.generalHeadline: Wet-snow avalanches can release where snow is sufficient
